item.title: Battlefield 6 Leaked Gameplay Highlights Urban Warfare Destruction
item.description:
Summary

  • Battlefield 6 leaks showcase impressive tech for destructive urban warfare.
  • EA's Battlefield Labs allows players to offer feedback during development.
  • Leaked footage hints at return to core elements like destructible environments.

Some recently leaked gameplay of Battlefield 6 shows off some of the impressive tech that could fuel destructive urban warfare in the latest entry in the franchise. The Battlefield series has long been known for its large-scale battles and destructible environments. However, recent entries received mixed reception due to design changes that steered the franchise away from these core elements, something that might be changing with Battlefield 6 .

EA announced in February 2025 that players could sign up for Battlefield Labs and offer feedback on the game while it was still in development, and news about the newest entry in the series has been ramping up thanks to the project. Although the series has been dormant since the release of Battlefield 2042 in November 2021, the implementation of Labs was seen as a positive sign for those awaiting a new installment in the beloved franchise, with fans keen to get their hands on the game.

Twitter user goodboy posted three clips of Battlefield 6 gameplay, notably featuring environmental destruction like tanks smashing through walls and artillery wrecking buildings to expose players hiding behind cover. This isn’t the first time Battlefield Labs leaks have shown large-scale destruction, and the re-emergence of this mechanic in the latest leaked footage suggests that it may again become a core gameplay feature.

Leaked Battlefield 6 Gameplay Highlights Environmental Destruction

As with any modern game in development, leaks are bound to slip through, regardless of players signing NDAs. In March 2025, another leak suggested that 3D spotting may return in Battlefield 6 , a mechanic that some longtime fans consider controversial. With playtesting through Battlefield Labs still ongoing, this likely won’t be the end of the footage that will be shared early with the public.

It’s likely a good sign that EA is allowing players to go hands-on with the game while it’s still in development, especially considering the mixed reception of Battlefield 2042 and its introduction of classes. While it’s always interesting to see early footage, it’s worth remembering that all Battlefield 6 leaks should be taken with a grain of salt. Still, if the clips are accurate and the game delivers destructible maps alongside massive multiplayer battles, Battlefield 6 could mark a major return to form for the series.

item.title: Xbox Launches Sale for Critically-Acclaimed Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Xbox is hosting a massive sale on critically acclaimed games through May 27.
  • Available titles include The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, Cult of the Lamb, Dragon Age: The Veilguard, and WWE 2K25.
  • Game Pass Ultimate subscribers can also snag additional deals.

Xbox is hosting a massive sale consisting of critically acclaimed games, allowing players to choose from a wide selection of titles at a discount price, including popular games such as Cult of the Lamb and The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt . Players who have been waiting for an Xbox sale to acquire any of these highly-rated games should check it out before it comes to an end on May 27.

The popularity of digital media has increased considerably over the past few years. There is no doubt that digital games offer an ease that appeals to the community at large, as players can switch between titles with the click of a button as long as they are downloaded onto their preferred platform. Additionally, digital media platforms regularly host sales that give fans the opportunity to acquire games at incredible prices. An ongoing Xbox sale is offering up some heavy hitters for record-low prices, prompting many gamers to fatten their libraries while they can.

Xbox gamers will be happy to know that the Microsoft Store currently has a huge sale underway for critically acclaimed titles, ranging from indie roguelike games to massive RPGs that fans can easily sink hundreds of hours into. The standout titles in this sale are Dragon Age: The Veilguard , available at a discount of 45 percent, along with Mass Effect 3 and The Witcher 3 at only 10 percent of their original price, costing $5.99 and $3.99, respectively.

These bargains are available for everyone on Xbox, as they don't require a Game Pass subscription. Additionally, they will be applied to anyone who purchases these games before May 27, so gamers have some time to decide if they want to pull the trigger or not. Players who enjoyed Cyberpunk 2077 but held off on acquiring its DLC might find this the right time to finally do it, as the 25 percent discount puts its final price at $22.49. If players are into adventure games, then The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and Mass Effect Legendary Edition are definitely worth a shot for this price. Gamers who would rather indulge in sports games, WWE 2K25 and NBA 2K25 might be right up their alley.

Moreover, players can gain access to an additional selection of critically acclaimed games on sale if they own Game Pass Ultimate. The subscription service gives exclusive offers, such as Cult of the Lamb: Sinful Edition at half price and BioShock: The Collection with a discount of 80 percent.

item.title: Geralt Actor Comments on Witcher 4 Ciri 'Woke' Controversy
item.description:
Summary

  • Doug Cockle supports Ciri as the main character in The Witcher 4, calling complaints about her "stupid."
  • Cockle emphasizes that Ciri has rich lore from the books for CDPR to explore in the new game.

Doug Cockle, the voice of Geralt of Rivia himself, has just spoken out about the controversy over Ciri taking his place as the main character of The Witcher 4 . The next Witcher game marks a new era for CDPR’s dark fantasy RPG series, with a new protagonist stepping in as the titular monster hunter. Ciri will be that protagonist in The Witcher 4 after her supporting role in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt .

Many fans are excited to play as Ciri in The Witcher 4 , but not everyone is on board with the shift from having Geralt as the main protagonist. In a trend that has become sadly common among titles like Assassin’s Creed Shadows and Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet , some social media users have complained that The Witcher 4 is “going woke” by featuring a female playable character and arguing that it goes against the lore of the series. CDPR game developers have argued that this is not the case, and now Geralt himself is lending his support.

Doug Cockle was reading and reacting to fan memes in a video published by Fall Damage when he came across one noting the complaints about Ciri in The Witcher 4 . He quickly voiced his support for Ciri, calling the complaints about the game being woke “stupid” and expressing his excitement at the prospect of following a new, “cool” character in the next Witcher game. He also said that Geralt can’t be the main character in The Witcher forever, and the Witcher books have plenty of lore supporting Ciri’s new role as the lead protagonist.

Doug Cockle Calls Witcher 4 Ciri Complaints ‘Stupid’

Cockled added that if the so-called “fans” complaining about Ciri in The Witcher 4 had actually read the Witcher books from Andrzej Sapkowski, they would know that she has plenty of rich lore that would be prime material for CDPR to dive into with its next game. He said that this material largely went unexplored in the previous Witcher games due to Geralt being the focus, but now the time is right to dig deeper in The Witcher 4 .

While he is stepping away from the spotlight in The Witcher 4 , Doug Cockle will return as Geralt, though the extent of his presence in the game is unknown at this time. As Cockle himself has pointed out, Geralt’s story in the games seemingly concluded with The Witcher 3’s Blood and Wine DLC back in 2016. The Witcher 4 will instead shift the focus to Ciri, and it’s only fitting that the voice of Geralt is excited to pass the torch in the next game.

item.title: CoD Warzone: How To Get Forecast On Verdansk
item.description:
Call of Duty: Warzone offers players a wide-open Battle Royale experience, featuring both large-scale action on Verdansk and the fast-paced gameplay of Resurgence, where players can dive in, loot up, and battle until the last man or team is standing. From getting their hands on the top meta weapons to learning strategies to outplay the competition, there's a lot to uncover, regardless of which mode they play.

When it comes to Warzone , there are numerous ways to increase the chances of victory. However, one of the most important strategies players can employ is positioning themselves in a prime spot within the game's safe zones. Luckily, there is a method that allows players to reveal future circles on Verdansk, granting them access to a forecast. Here is how to reveal future safe zones on Verdansk in Warzone .

How To Reveal Future Safe Zones On Verdansk In Warzone

While the Forecast Scorestreak is notably absent from Verdansk, there is still a reliable way that players can reveal future safe zones during a match. To gain a sneak peek of the upcoming safe zone in Verdansk, players will need to complete a Recon Contract.

Recon Contracts can be found scattered all around Verdansk, with each one being clearly marked on the map by a Flag Icon. Players can also get their hands on a guaranteed Recon Contract by choosing to drop onto the moving train , which continues to respawn at different intervals throughout the match.

Once players have located a Recon Contract, they can accept it just like any other type of contract. Upon activation, a capture location will appear and be marked on both the player's HUD and Tac Map. Players must then make their way over to this designated location and remain inside the capture zone for a set amount of time to fill up the progress bar. This bar will fill up more quickly if multiple squadmates are also standing within the radius.

Upon successfully capturing the zone, the contract will be marked as completed, rewarding players with some cash, loot, along with revealing the next safe zone on the player's Tac Map. This intel-based benefit also stacks, which means that if players manage to complete multiple Recon Contracts in quick succession, they will be able to reveal all future circles for the match.

This essentially grants them access to a full-circle forecast, allowing players to plan ahead in their Battle Royale match and avoid falling victim to the gas.

Call of Duty: Warzone

item.title: Most Oblivion Remastered Players Aren't Bothering to Complete the Main Quest
item.description:
Summary

  • Only 3.10% of players on Xbox have completed the main quest in Oblivion Remastered.
  • Guild storylines are seeing higher completion rates than the main quest.
  • It seems most players aren't interested in seeing Oblivion Remastered's main quest to its conclusion.

Only 3.10% of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered players on Xbox have completed the game's main quest. The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered was shadow dropped last month and was an instant success. Nostalgic gamers and those who never played the original alike flocked to Bethesda's open world epic to adventure around Cyrodiil.

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered , like many Bethesda games, has a main quest that can effectively be ignored. In fact, players are only required to engage with The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered 's main quest during the tutorial section in the sewer. Once they make it to the open world, they can do whatever they want. It seems the vast majority of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered players are indeed ignoring the game's main quest, as it has an abysmally low completion rate.

Based on Xbox achievement stats, it seems as though only 3.10% of players on the platform have managed to finish Oblivion Remastered 's main quest. Now, it's worth pointing out that Oblivion Remastered 's main quest isn't particularly long or demanding. It seems most would just rather do other things in Oblivion than see the main storyline through to its conclusion.

Only 3.10% of Players Have Completed Oblivion Remastered's Main Quest

In fact, four out of the five major guilds in Oblivion Remastered have higher completion rates than the main quest. 11.21% of players have completed Oblivion Remastered 's Arena, while 4.16% have finished The Dark Brotherhood. 3.39% have wrapped up the Mages Guild, and 3.14% have finished the Thieves Guild. The only major Oblivion Remastered guild with a lower completion rate than the main quest is the Fighters Guild, which only 2.51% of players have finished.

It's safe to say that the bulk of Oblivion Remastered players that haven't completed the main quest haven't done so out of simply not wanting to do it, but there are those who literally can't. Some Oblivion Remastered players have been locked out of finishing the main quest, like one player who accidentally told key characters to "wait" in a location that is later destroyed, effectively removing them from the game.

There are certainly pros and cons to tackling Oblivion Remastered 's main quest right away. Due to the way Oblivion Remastered level scaling works, those that wait to do the main quest may have a tougher time completing certain quests, but some may prefer to get the rewards associated with the major guilds before going through the main story. Ultimately, Oblivion Remastered players are free to play the game however they want, and it will definitely be interesting to see if the main quest completion rate overtakes some of the guilds as time goes on.
